medical_history.chief_complaint: Refractory hypercalcemia due to metastatic parathyroid carcinoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at age 35 with nontraumatic bilateral patellar tendon rupture and was found to have elevated calcium levels of 20.5 mg/dL and PTH of 1692 pg/mL. Hypercalcemia became recurrent after initial stabilization, with calcium levels rising as treatment progressed over months, indicating disease progression.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Primary hyperparathyroidism with resection of a presumed right inferior parathyroid adenoma 7 years earlier.
medical_history.family_history: Negative for kidney stones, elevated calcium levels, jaw tumors, or malignancy.
